In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    res = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(res) + length(word) > text_width
            res *= "\n"
        end
        
        res *= "$word "
    end
    
    return res
end
```

You can call the function with a string as follows: 

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test of wrapping functionality. It will wrap lines when the text width limit is exceeded.", 20))
```
The output would be:

```
This is a test 
of wrapping 
functionality. 
It will wrap 
lines when the 
text width limit 
is exceeded.
```
